April 21f 1969
Mr* Donald Quayle
Director of Network Affairs
Corporation for Public Breadcasting
555 Madison Avenue
New York, New York 10022
Dear Don:
The Corporation*s Monday Memo dated April 18
invites reaction to the transmission of sports
events on national interconnection.
It strikes me as a misalignment of priorities
to discuss such programming when there are
unfilled meeds in critical programming.
Long range, I would not be opposed to the broadcasting
by radio and TV of certain sports events* To do
so now would be premature.
Interconnection of radio stations for news and
public affairs programming ( and a variety of
others) should be higher on CPB's priority
listing.
Sincerely,
Robert A. Mott
Executive Director, NER
RAM/Cb
cc: Richard Estell
William Harley
